--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Derek James <djames@g...> wrote:
> On Wed, 5 May 2004 22:03:16 -0700 (PDT), Tyler Streeter
> <tylerstreeter@y...> wrote:
> > 
> > What's the easiest way to do speciation visualization
> > without writing a lot of code?  I'm using Ken's
> > original source, but in a cross-platform way... so I
> > can't use the GTK stuff.
> 
> I've been meaning to ask Ken more details about how he produced the
> speciation graphs in his papers.  Is that speciation visualization
> built into your release, Ken?  Is this what Tyler's referring to?
> 

Yeah my release produces the visualizations.  I don't really know 
that there is any way of producing these visualizations that's 
easier than just writing the code to do it.  Perhaps it would be 
easier to generate XML and then have it turned into a picture like 
Derek and Philip do....I personally generated screen graphics using 
gtk.  But the work of keeping track of species sizes and borders 
(for the purposes of visualizing) has to be done somewhat in code so 
the data is there at the end (or as it runs, if you are trying to 
visualize during a run).

ken
